intro: Maihueniopsis molinensis, commonly known as the Andean rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, arranged in a rosette, and its stems are often short and unbranched. Maihueniopsis molinensis is notable for its resilience and is often found in mountainous regions where few plants can survive.
